article.headline: St. Bonaventure beats Binghamton 69-51
article.story: BINGHAMTON, N.Y. -- Marcus Posely scored 20 points and had four steals, Dion Wright added 13 points, and St. Bonaventure beat Binghamton 69-51 on Saturday to give the 7-2 Bonnies their best start to a season since the 2001-02 team started 8-2. Dion Wright scored 13 points for the Bonnies, Jaylen Adams had 12, and Youssou Ndoye, the Atlantic 10 Conference's leading rebounder, had 11 boards. Yosef Yacob opened with a jumper for Binghamton, but it was all St. Bonaventure after that. Andell Cumberbatch's jumper kicked off a 13-4 run and the Bonnies led 26-22 at halftime. The Bonnies used an 8-2 run to lead 34-24 in the second half after a 3-pointer by Adams. Binghamton pulled within one point, 35-34, after a jumper by Nick Madray, but Adams hit two 3-pointers and Posely added two more and the Bonnies pulled away. Madray scored 20 for Binghamton (1-12), who have lost 10 straight.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
